header_summary: Antoine Riard raises concerns about the safety of OP_EVICT in the context of an off-chain payment pool. He suggests possible solutions and questions how to address the high interactivity issue. Vincenzo Palazzo finds the conclusion of a previous discussion confusing and suggests improving BIP 21. ZmnSCPxj discusses the fidelity bond of M and explores alternatives to the "sign-only-once" mechanism. Gijs van Dam and Tony Giorgio discuss decorrelated payments and refer to a research write-up. Lloyd Fournier discusses a downside of using the MuSig API. Vincenzo Palazzo acknowledges an error in his previous post and provides the correct link.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- The question of blockchain storage being limited can be answered with a 'yes'.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 can last 21 years without running out of space.
- Ongoing optimization efforts and affordable hardware ensure storage remains sufficient for practical usage.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
